subject: RE: [junit] Re: ClassNotFoundException
msgSnippet: Are you saying that you are unable to run JUnit in VAJ at all.  Shouldn t be an issue.  You definitely have something set up wrong.  can you tell us your setup
messageBody:
Are you saying that you are unable to run JUnit in VAJ at all. Shouldn't be
an issue. You definitely have something set up wrong. can you tell us your
setup (eg. what you are running, how, what's in your workspace classpath,
what your default.ini file looks like, etc.)

-Jason

> -----Original Message-----
> From: messy_head_2001@... [mailto:messy_head_2001@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, August 22, 2001 11:42 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: ClassNotFoundException
>
>
> Yeah I've definitely put the classpath in the TestRunner
> class and
> I've added my project to the workspace classpath in VisualAge...
>
> but I think it must be a classpath issue, as if I run
> JUnit from the
> tools menu in Visual Age it cannot find any of my classes.
>
>
>
>
> --- In junit@y..., Mark Meyers <markm@m...> wrote:
> > Check if you start JUnit with the searchpath for
> "myclass" in it's
> > classpath...
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: messy_head_2001@y... [mailto:messy_head_2001@y...]
> > Sent: woensdag 22 augustus 2001 15:47
> > To: junit@y...
> > Subject: [junit] ClassNotFoundException
> >
> >
> > I am trying to use JUnit to test a method which calls
> >
> > Class.forName("myClassName")
> >
> > however I get a ClassNotFoundException from this line of code,
> which
> > works perfectly when not using JUnit.
> >
> > Any ideas??
> >
> > David.
> >
> >
